publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-202 Ian McKee: Younger Patients with Dementia—That the Parliament notes that in Lothian region there are between 170 and 225 people under the age of 65 who suffer from severe dementia and between 1,350 and 1,650 across Scotland and, recognising the heavy burden that falls on those caring for anyone with dementia and the special needs of younger patients with this condition, considers that the benefits of free personal care for the elderly should also be applied to this group.
